ISSUE.TITLE: [Bug]: podman commit --pause has contradicting documentation
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description The documentation for the [podman commit](https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-commit.1.html) command states that: > The container and its processes are paused while the image is committed. This minimizes the likelihood of data corruption when creating the new image. If this is not desired, the --pause OPTION can be set to false. It's therefore implied that the default behavior is pausing during the commit. The problem is that scrolling down to the pause parameter section: > --pause, -p > Pause the container when creating an image. The default is false. So it seems that the default behavior is not pausing during the commit.
